org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsFileEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFileEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PwsFileEvent
extends java.util.EventObject
    Events available for PwsFileListener objects.

    RECORD_ADDED when a record is added to the list
    RECORD_REMOVED when a record is removeded from the list
    RECORD_UPDATED when an existing record in the list has been updated
    LIST_CLEARED when the list was cleared (all records removed)
    LIST_UPDATED when the list content was modified in a multi-record or unknown way
    LIST_SAVED when the list has been saved to a persistent state (all records)
    TARGET_ALTERED when the persistency target definition of a file has been changed
    PASSPHRASE_ALTERED when the passphrase definition of a file has been changed
    CONTENT_ALTERED when some content of the file has been altered that is not covered by one of the other event types (e.g. file option string)

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public PwsFileEvent(java.lang.Object source,

        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        source - the event issuing object

    • Method Detail

      • getRecord

        public PwsRecord getRecord()
        The record involved in the event or null if unavailable. By convention the returned record is a clone of the corresponding record in the list.

        public int getType()
        The event type.
